content: The Act is titled the "Stop Adolescent Smoking Without Excessive Bureaucracy Act of 2008" and aims to strengthen state laws regarding tobacco product sales to individuals under the age of 18. For fiscal year 2010 and subsequent years, the Secretary can grant under section 1921 if the State has a law prohibiting the sale of tobacco products to individuals under 18 and the purchase by individuals under 18. It is illegal for a retailer to sell tobacco products to individuals under 18. It is also illegal for individuals under 18 to purchase, receive, or possess tobacco products in public places. Minors under 18 are prohibited from purchasing, receiving, or possessing tobacco products in public places. If a minor is found to have violated these laws, law enforcement must notify their parent, guardian, or custodian. Minors under 18 who purchase, receive, or possess tobacco products in public places must have their parent, guardian, or custodian notified.
